rows.text: No wild card will match because host1.example. exists. Instead you will get an answer of "no error, but no data". The wildcard MX record does not provide MX records for domains that otherwise exist.
No wild card will match because sub.*.example. exists. The domain sub.*.example. will never act as a wild card, even though it has an asterisk in it.
No wild card will match because _tcp.host1.example. exists (without data).

No wild card will match because subdel.example. exists and is a zone cut, putting host.subdel.example. into a different DNS zone. Even if host.subdel.example. does not exist in the other zone, a wild card will not be used from the parent zone.
No wild card will match because *.example. exists, it is a wild card domain, but it still exists.
